text.School of Politics, Security, and Intl A: School of Politics, Security, and Intl Affairs

p.A minimum GPA of 2.0 is required in all: A minimum GPA of 2.0 is required in all courses used to satisfy the minor.
p.Grades below \"C\" (2.0) in lower level: Grades below "C" (2.0) in lower level courses are not accepted.
p.At least 12 hours used in the minor must: At least 12 hours used in the minor must be earned at UCF within the School of Politics, Security, and Intl Affairs.
p.Double major/dual degree policy in Polit: Double major/dual degree policy in Political Science programs and minors (Note: The myKnight Audit cannot capture overlapping courses between two or more programs; therefore, students should have their program reviewed by the School before filing for graduation.):
p.Students who double minor in Political S: Students who double minor in Political Science/Prelaw and International and Global Studies shall not count more than one course toward both programs.
p.Students who major in International and: Students who major in International and Global Studies, and minor in Political Science/Prelaw shall not count more than one course toward both programs, except the following: POS2041 - American National Government

li.A minimum GPA of 2.0 is required in all: A minimum GPA of 2.0 is required in all courses used to satisfy the minor.
li.Grades below \"C\" (2.0) in lower level: Grades below "C" (2.0) in lower level courses are not accepted.
li.At least 12 hours used in the minor must: At least 12 hours used in the minor must be earned at UCF within the School of Politics, Security, and Intl Affairs.
li.Double major/dual degree policy in Polit:
Double major/dual degree policy in Political Science programs and minors (Note: The myKnight Audit cannot capture overlapping courses between two or more programs; therefore, students should have their program reviewed by the School before filing for graduation.):
Students who double minor in Political Science/Prelaw and International and Global Studies shall not count more than one course toward both programs.
Students who major in International and Global Studies, and minor in Political Science/Prelaw shall not count more than one course toward both programs, except the following: POS2041 - American National Government
li.Students who double minor in Political S: Students who double minor in Political Science/Prelaw and International and Global Studies shall not count more than one course toward both programs.
li.Students who major in International and: Students who major in International and Global Studies, and minor in Political Science/Prelaw shall not count more than one course toward both programs, except the following: POS2041 - American National Government
li.Most courses for this minor will have pr: Most courses for this minor will have prerequisites completed as a part of a student's GEP requirement, as general electives, or a student can enroll into courses with consent of instructor.

courseSection0.text:
Minor Requirements
A minimum GPA of 2.0 is required in all courses used to satisfy the minor.
Grades below "C" (2.0) in lower level courses are not accepted.
At least 12 hours used in the minor must be earned at UCF within the School of Politics, Security, and Intl Affairs.
Double major/dual degree policy in Political Science programs and minors (Note: The myKnight Audit cannot capture overlapping courses between two or more programs; therefore, students should have their program reviewed by the School before filing for graduation.):
Students who double minor in Political Science/Prelaw and International and Global Studies shall not count more than one course toward both programs.
Students who major in International and Global Studies, and minor in Political Science/Prelaw shall not count more than one course toward both programs, except the following: POS2041 - American National Government
Prerequisite Courses
Most courses for this minor will have prerequisites completed as a part of a student's GEP requirement, as general electives, or a student can enroll into courses with consent of instructor.

courseSection1.text0:
Complete at least 1 of the following: 
INR4401 - International Law (3)
POS4603 - American Constitutional Law I (3)
POS4604 - American Constitutional Law II (3)
courseSection1.text1:
Earn at least 9 credits from the following types of courses: 
Select three (3) upper-division political science courses (courses with prefixes CPO, INR, POS, POT, and PUP; and GEO 3471, which is also a Political Science course.

See the Political Science Major description for a list of courses that may be offered by the school).

Only three hours of credit for internships, independent study, or directed reading may be counted:

li.Co-op, or Independent Study credit canno: Co-op, or Independent Study credit cannot be used toward the minor without prior school permission.

courseSection1.text:
Other Requirements

Co-op, or Independent Study credit cannot be used toward the minor without prior school permission.
